comments:
I get the following error message when trying to do an update of a file from CVS
that someone else committed.  After looking at the file in the repository, I
believe the problem is that Eclipse is expecting there to be 8 characters before
the beginning of the date string, but in the CVSNT file there are four spaces
and a tab.  I've included an excerpt of the file below the stack trace.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Stack Trace/Error Log Entry:
----------------------------------------------------------------------------

!MESSAGE Host 'trinity' is running CVS NT (version 1.11.1.3) which is not fully
supported. However, most functionality is available.
!ENTRY org.eclipse.team.ui 4 1 Jul 23, 2002 21:43:41.856
!MESSAGE Internal error occured.
!STACK 0
java.lang.StringIndexOutOfBoundsException: String index out of range: 8

public class Test {

Ok, the tabs got dropped in the CVS file.  If you need a copy of the file to
demonstrate the problem, please let me know and I'll send one, but it should be
easily reproducible if you have a CVSNT 1.11.1.3 server available to test against.

More steps to reproduce, since I wasn't paying attention the first time through.  

1. Create a project, add a file to it, and Team -> Share the project and file on
a repository somewhere and commit.
2. From the CVS Explorer, check out the project that you just added to
repository as a new project with a different name. 
3. Edit the file in the new project and commit the changes back to the repository.
4. Attempt to Synchronize or Update from the original project and you should
generate the stack trace.

Also, I did a quickie test on Linux and it looks like it puts a tab in the fifth
position (ie: before the date) as well -- the only difference between the two
files was that the CVSNT one had a line with:

expand
@o@;

After the comment line.  Otherwse the structure appeared to be the same.  I'll
freely admit that I'm not all that familiar with the inner workings of CVS but
I'm more than happy to help out any way that I can.

Unabled to reproduce on newly built 2.0.  I think I may have been running an
older snapshot and not realized it -- I've closed this bug for the time being
and I'll re-open it if I can reproduce it at a later date.
